alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 6:05PM MST until July 31 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 605 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across east Flagstaff. Between 1.25 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Flagstaff Mall, and Cosnino. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 198 and 207. U.S. Highway 89 near mile marker 419. Route 66 between mile markers 197 and 204. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... San Francisco Wash and Walnut Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
